discussion.content:
C. grep
F. find
grep is a powerful command-line tool used to search for patterns within text files. In this case, the technician can use grep to search for files that contain the partial filename provided by the customer.

find is another useful command-line tool for searching files and directories. It can be used to locate files based on various criteria, such as filename, file size, modification date, and file permissions. By combining find with grep, the technician can efficiently search for the missing file.

Google Gemini

questions.question_text: A customer who uses a Linux OS called the help desk to request assistance in locating a missing file. The customer does not know the exact name of the file but can provide a partial file name. Which of the following tools should the technician use? (Choose two.)
A technician needs to update the software on several hundred Mac laptops. Which of the following is the best method to complete the task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
use mobile device management (MDM) to manage software updates on multiple supervised Mac laptops. MDM allows administrators to wirelessly send profiles and commands to devices, including updating software and device settings

Selected Answer: D
D makes perfect sense, A and D are the same thing only D you are going to manually go and set permissions on a file by file basis, instead of doing the entire subfolder?

Selected Answer: A
D doesnt make sense

Selected Answer: A
By turning off inheritance on the specific folder, the permissions from the parent folder will no longer apply to this folder. The technician can then assign custom permissions for that folder, ensuring only the immediate team has access. Manually setting the requested permissions at the folder level ensures that no inherited permissions override the access controls for this sensitive material.

Turning inheritance back on for child folders could inadvertently reapply permissions that conflict with the restricted access, undermining the security intended for the confidential material.

choices.A: Turn off inheritance on the requested folder only and set the requested permissions to each file manually.
choices.C: Turn off inheritance at the top-level folder and set permissions to each file and subfolder manually.
choices.B: Turn off inheritance at the top-level folder and remove all inherited permissions.
choices.D: Turn off inheritance on the requested folder only, set the requested permissions, and then turn on inheritance under the child folders.

questions.question_text: A company uses shared drives as part of a workforce collaboration process. To ensure the correct access permissions, inheritance at the top-level folder is assigned to each department. A manager's team is working on confidential material and wants to ensure only the immediate team can view a specific folder and its subsequent files and subfolders. Which of the following actions should the technician most likely take?

discussion.content: Its kinda misleading. a 64bit OS can use more that 4GB, a 32 bit can only use up to 4GB of RAM. The question is implying that by changing to 64Bit you can use the full 6GB of Ram that the new Application requires.

Selected Answer: C
The 64-bit version of Windows handles large amounts of random access memory (RAM) more effectively than a 32-bit system

questions.question_text:
A department has the following technical requirements for a new application:

Quad Core processor -
250GB of hard drive space
6GB of RAM

Touch screens -
The company plans to upgrade from a 32-bit Windows OS to a 64-bit OS. Which of the following will the company be able to fully take advantage of after the upgrade?

discussion.content:
A. Remote wipe
Remote wipe is the most secure method to protect a mobile device from unwanted access. It allows the administrator to remotely erase all data on the device, preventing unauthorized access to sensitive information in case the device is lost or stolen.

While biometrics, PINs, and log-in attempt restrictions can add layers of security, they may not be sufficient to protect the device completely. Remote wipe provides an additional safeguard to ensure that the device's data remains secure.

Google Gemini
